responses.text: Your success depends on how many uncomfortable conversations you're willing to have. A former boss taught this when a direct negotiation changed my life.
You can always tell someone to go to hell tomorrow. Warren Buffett suggests cooling down before reacting to avoid rash decisions.
The only measure of a man that matters is from the eyes up. A disabled mentor proved hardships donâ€™t define your potential.
No one great at something started that way. Growth and skill come from time, practice, and perseverance.
Don't prepare the road for your kids; prepare your kids for the road. Shielding them too much harms their readiness for real life.
